member.summary: Get a list of categories used to tag items in Spotify (on, for example, the Spotify player's "Browse" tab).
member.param: Optional. A country: a . Provide this parameter to ensure that the category exists for a particular country.

Optional. The desired language, consisting of an ISO 639-1 language code and an ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code, joined by an underscore. For example: es_MX, meaning "Spanish (Mexico)". Provide this parameter if you want the category strings returned in a particular language. Note that, if locale is not supplied, or if the specified language is not available, the category strings returned will be in the Spotify default language (American English).
Optional. Maximum number of results to return. Default: 20, Minimum: 1, Maximum: 50.
Optional. The index of the first result to return. Default: 0 (the first result). Use with limit to get the next page of search results.

member.typeparam: Type to deserialise result to.
member.param: Optional. A country: a . Provide this parameter to ensure that the category exists for a particular country.

Optional. The desired language, consisting of an ISO 639-1 language code and an ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code, joined by an underscore. For example: es_MX, meaning "Spanish (Mexico)". Provide this parameter if you want the category strings returned in a particular language. Note that, if locale is not supplied, or if the specified language is not available, the category strings returned will be in the Spotify default language (American English).
Optional. Maximum number of results to return. Default: 20, Minimum: 1, Maximum: 50.
Optional. The index of the first result to return. Default: 0 (the first result). Use with limit to get the next page of search results.
Optional. A valid access token from the Spotify Accounts service, used for this call only. See constructors for other ways to provide an access token.
member.returns: Result deserialised to `T`.

member.summary: Get a list of Spotify featured playlists (shown, for example, on a Spotify player's "Browse" tab).

Optional. The desired language, consisting of an ISO 639-1 language code and an ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code, joined by an underscore. For example: es_MX, meaning "Spanish (Mexico)". Provide this parameter if you want the category strings returned in a particular language. member.summary: An implementation of the API Wrapper for the Spotify Web API Episodes endpoints.

member.name: M:SpotifyApi.NetCore.EpisodesApi.GetEpisode(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Get Spotify catalog information for a single episode identified by its unique Spotify ID.
member.param: The Spotify ID for the episode.

Optional. An ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code or the string from_token . If a country code is specified, only shows and episodes that are available in that market will be returned. If a valid user access token is specified in the request header, the country associated with the user account will take priority over this parameter. Note: If neither market or user country are provided, the content is considered unavailable for the client. Users can view the country that is associated with their account in the account settings.
member.returns: A Task that, once successfully completed, returns a full object.

If a valid user access token is specified in the request header, the country associated with the user account will take priority over this parameter. Note: If neither market or user country are provided, the content is considered unavailable for the client. Users can view the country that is associated with their account in the account settings.
member.returns: A Task that, once successfully completed, returns a full object.

member.summary: Add the current user as a follower of a playlist.
member.param: Required. The Spotify ID of the playlist. Any playlist can be followed, regardless of its public/private status, as long as you know its playlist ID.
Optional. Defaults to true. If true the playlist will be included in user’s public playlists, if false it will remain private.

member.summary: Delete one or more shows from current Spotify user’s library.
member.param: Required. A comma-separated list of the show Spotify IDs. A maximum of 50 show IDs can be sent in one request. A minimum of 1 show id is required.

Optional. An ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code or the string from_token . If a country code is specified, only shows that are available in that market will be removed. If a valid user access token is specified in the request header, the country associated with the user account will take priority over this parameter. Note: If neither market or user country are provided, the content is considered unavailable for the client. Users can view the country that is associated with their account in the account settings.
The bearer token which is gotten during the authentication/authorization process.

member.name: M:SpotifyApi.NetCore.IPersonalizationApi.GetUsersTopArtists(System.Int32,System.Int32,SpotifyApi.NetCore.TimeRange,System.String)
member.summary: Get the current user’s top artists based on calculated affinity.
member.param: Optional. The maximum number of entities to return. Default: 20. Minimum: 1. Maximum: 50.
Optional. The index of the first object to return. Default: 0 (i.e., the first object). Use with limit to get the next set of objects.

Optional. Over what time frame the affinities are computed. Valid values: long_term (calculated from several years of data and including all new data as it becomes available), medium_term (approximately last 6 months), short_term (approximately last 4 weeks). Default: medium_term.
member.returns: A Task that, once successfully completed, returns a full object.

member.name: T:SpotifyApi.NetCore.IPlayerApi
member.summary: Player API endpoints.

member.name: M:SpotifyApi.NetCore.IPlayerApi.PlayTracks(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int64)
member.summary: BETA. Play a Track on the user’s active device.
member.param: Spotify track Id to play

Optional. A valid access token from the Spotify Accounts service. The access token must have been issued on behalf of a user. The access token must have the `user-modify-playback-state` scope authorized in order to control playback.
Optional. The id of the device this command is targeting. If not supplied, the user’s currently active device is the target.

Optional. Indicates from what position to start playback. Must be a positive number. Passing in a position that is greater than the length of the track will cause the player to start playing the next song.

member.name: M:SpotifyApi.NetCore.IPlayerApi.GetCurrentPlaybackInfo(System.String,System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: BETA. Get information about the user’s current playback state, including track, track progress, and active device.
member.param: Optional. A valid access token from the Spotify Accounts service. The access token must have been issued on behalf of a user. The access token must have the `user-read-playback-state` scope authorized in order to control playback.
Optional. A or the string from_token. Provide this parameter if you want to apply Track Relinking.

Optional. A comma-separated list of item types that your client supports besides the default track type. Valid types are: track and episode. An unsupported type in the response is expected to be represented as null value in the item field. Note: This parameter was introduced to allow existing clients to maintain their current behaviour and might be deprecated in the future. In addition to providing this parameter, make sure that your client properly handles cases of new types in the future by checking against the currently_playing_type field.
member.returns: Task of

member.name: M:SpotifyApi.NetCore.IPlayerApi.Seek(System.Int64,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: BETA. Seeks to the given position in the user’s currently playing track.
member.param: Required. The position in milliseconds to seek to. Must be a positive number. Passing in a position that is greater than the length of the track will cause the player to start playing the next song.

Optional. A valid access token from the Spotify Accounts service. The access token must have been issued on behalf of a user. The access token must have the `user-modify-playback-state` scope authorized in order to control playback.
Optional. The id of the device this command is targeting. If not supplied, the user’s currently active device is the target.

member.returns:
A completed request will return no response, and then issue the command to the player. Due to the asynchronous nature of the issuance of the command, you should use the endpoint to check that your issued command was handled correctly by the player.
When performing an action that is restricted, 404 NOT FOUND or 403 FORBIDDEN will be returned together with a player error message. For example, if there are no active devices found, the request will return 404 NOT FOUND response code and the reason NO_ACTIVE_DEVICE, or, if the user making the request is non-premium, a 403 FORBIDDEN response code will be returned together with the PREMIUM_REQUIRED reason.

member.name: M:SpotifyApi.NetCore.IPlaylistsApi.AddItemsToPlaylist(System.String,System.String[],System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String)
member.summary: Add one or more items to a user’s playlist.
member.param: Required. The Spotify ID for the playlist.

Required. A JSON array of the Spotify URIs to add, can be track or episode URIs. For example: {"uris": ["spotify:track:4iV5W9uYEdYUVa79Axb7Rh","spotify:track:1301WleyT98MSxVHPZCA6M", "spotify:episode:512ojhOuo1ktJprKbVcKyQ"]} A maximum of 100 items can be added in one request.

Optional. The position to insert the items, a zero-based index. For example, to insert the items in the first position: position=0 ; to insert the items in the third position: position=2. If omitted, the items will be appended to the playlist. Items are added in the order they appear in the uris array. For example: {"uris": ["spotify:track:4iV5W9uYEdYUVa79Axb7Rh","spotify:track:1301WleyT98MSxVHPZCA6M", "spotify:episode:512ojhOuo1ktJprKbVcKyQ"], "position": 3}
The bearer token which is gotten during the authentication/authorization process.
member.returns: A Task that, once successfully completed, returns a full object.

member.name: M:SpotifyApi.NetCore.IPlaylistsApi.ReorderItems(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Reorder an item or a group of items in a playlist.
member.param: The Spotify ID for the playlist.
Required. The position of the first item to be reordered.

Required. The position where the items should be inserted. To reorder the items to the end of the playlist, simply set to the position after the last item. Examples: To reorder the first item to the last position in a playlist with 10 items, set to 0, and to 10. To reorder the last item in a playlist with 10 items to the start of the playlist, set to 9, and to 0.

Optional. The amount of items to be reordered. Defaults to 1 if not set. The range of items to be reordered begins from the position, and includes the subsequent items. Example: To move the items at index 9-10 to the start of the playlist, is set to 9, and is set to 2.

Optional. The playlist’s snapshot ID against which you want to make the changes. The API will validate that the specified items exist and in the specified positions and make the changes, even if more recent changes have been made to the playlist.
Optional. A valid access token from the Spotify Accounts service.
member.returns: Task of

member.name: M:SpotifyApi.NetCore.LibraryApi.RemoveUsersSavedShows(System.String[],System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Delete one or more shows from current Spotify user’s library.
member.param: Required. A comma-separated list of the show Spotify IDs. A maximum of 50 show IDs can be sent in one request. A minimum of 1 show id is required.

Optional. An ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code or the string from_token . If a country code is specified, only shows that are available in that market will be removed. If a valid user access token is specified in the request header, the country associated with the user account will take priority over this parameter. Note: If neither market or user country are provided, the content is considered unavailable for the client. Users can view the country that is associated with their account in the account settings.
The bearer token which is gotten during the authentication/authorization process.

member.name: M:SpotifyApi.NetCore.PersonalizationApi.GetUsersTopArtists(System.Int32,System.Int32,SpotifyApi.NetCore.TimeRange,System.String)
member.summary: Get the current user’s top artists based on calculated affinity.
member.param: Optional. The maximum number of entities to return. Default: 20. Minimum: 1. Maximum: 50.
Optional. The index of the first object to return. Default: 0 (i.e., the first object). Use with limit to get the next set of objects.

Optional. Over what time frame the affinities are computed. Valid values: long_term (calculated from several years of data and including all new data as it becomes available), medium_term (approximately last 6 months), short_term (approximately last 4 weeks). Default: medium_term.
The bearer token which is gotten during the authentication/authorization process.
member.returns: A Task that, once successfully completed, returns a full object.

A valid access token from the Spotify Accounts service

member.name: M:SpotifyApi.NetCore.PlayerApi.PlayTracks(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int64)
member.summary: BETA. Play a Track on the user’s active device.
member.param: Spotify track Ids to play

Optional. A valid access token from the Spotify Accounts service. The access token must have been issued on behalf of a user. The access token must have the `user-modify-playback-state` scope authorized in order to control playback.
Optional. The id of the device this command is targeting. If not supplied, the user’s currently active device is the target.

Optional. Indicates from what position to start playback. Must be a positive number. Passing in a position that is greater than the length of the track will cause the player to start playing the next song.

member.returns:
A completed request will return no response, and then issue the command to the player. Due to the asynchronous nature of the issuance of the command, you should use the endpoint to check that your issued command was handled correctly by the player.
When performing an action that is restricted, 404 NOT FOUND or 403 FORBIDDEN will be returned together with a player error message. For example, if there are no active devices found, the request will return 404 NOT FOUND response code and the reason NO_ACTIVE_DEVICE, or, if the user making the request is non-premium, a 403 FORBIDDEN response code will be returned together with the PREMIUM_REQUIRED reason.

member.summary: Add one or more items to a user’s playlist.
member.param: Required. The Spotify ID for the playlist.

Required. A JSON array of the Spotify URIs to add, can be track or episode URIs. For example: {"uris": ["spotify:track:4iV5W9uYEdYUVa79Axb7Rh","spotify:track:1301WleyT98MSxVHPZCA6M", "spotify:episode:512ojhOuo1ktJprKbVcKyQ"]} A maximum of 100 items can be added in one request.

Optional. The position to insert the items, a zero-based index. For example, to insert the items in the first position: position=0 ; to insert the items in the third position: position=2. If omitted, the items will be appended to the playlist. Items are added in the order they appear in the uris array. For example: {"uris": ["spotify:track:4iV5W9uYEdYUVa79Axb7Rh","spotify:track:1301WleyT98MSxVHPZCA6M", "spotify:episode:512ojhOuo1ktJprKbVcKyQ"], "position": 3}

member.name: M:SpotifyApi.NetCore.PlaylistsApi.ReorderItems(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Reorder an item or a group of items in a playlist.
member.param: The Spotify ID for the playlist.
Required. The position of the first item to be reordered.

Required. The position where the items should be inserted. To reorder the items to the end of the playlist, simply set to the position after the last item. Examples: To reorder the first item to the last position in a playlist with 10 items, set to 0, and to 10. To reorder the last item in a playlist with 10 items to the start of the playlist, set to 9, and to 0.

Optional. The amount of items to be reordered. Defaults to 1 if not set. The range of items to be reordered begins from the position, and includes the subsequent items. Example: To move the items at index 9-10 to the start of the playlist, is set to 9, and is set to 2.

Optional. The playlist’s snapshot ID against which you want to make the changes. The API will validate that the specified items exist and in the specified positions and make the changes, even if more recent changes have been made to the playlist.
Optional. A valid access token from the Spotify Accounts service.
member.returns: Task of

member.summary: Get Spotify Catalog information about artists, albums, tracks or playlists that match a keyword string.
member.param: Search query keywords and optional field filters and operators. For example: `q=roadhouse%20blues`. See also https://developer.spotify.com/documentation/web-api/reference/search/search/#writing-a-query---guidelines
Specify multiple to search across.

Optional. Choose a . If a country code is specified, only artists, albums, and tracks with content that is playable in that market is returned. Note: Playlist results are not affected by the market parameter.

Optional. Maximum number of results to return. Default: 20, Minimum: 1, Maximum: 50. Note: The limit is applied within each type, not on the total response. For example, if the limit value is 3 and the type is `artist,album`, the response contains 3 artists and 3 albums.
Optional. The index of the first result to return. Default: 0 (the first result). Maximum offset (including limit): 10,000. Use with limit to get the next page of search results.
Optional. A valid access token from the Spotify Accounts service, used for this call only. See constructors for more ways to provide access tokens.
member.typeparam: Optionally provide your own type to deserialise Spotify's response to.
member.returns: Task of T. The Spotify response is deserialised as T.
